sentences.english: Good. I'll have water-melon, and bring me some egg tarts, please.
sentences.chinese: 好的，我要西瓜，另外，再給我一些蛋撻。

sentences.english: Like all the best foods, the custard tart is simplicity itself.
sentences.chinese: 就像所有最好的食物一樣，奶油蛋撻的製作很簡單。

sentences.english: The egg tart has a bit adhibit pan, but doesn't influence the taste.
sentences.chinese: 這個蛋撻有點粘鍋，但不影響味道的。

sentences.english: I'd like to have a Multi-Layer Cake and two Custard '.
sentences.chinese: 我想要一塊千層糕，兩塊蛋撻。

sentences.english: Called ‘doucets’ in the Middle Ages, they were equally popular at the court of Henry VIII.
sentences.chinese: 在亨利八世時期的宮廷裏，蛋撻同樣廣受青睞。

sentences.english: Custard tarts must be an ancient invention, given the wide spread of variations across the world.
sentences.chinese: 肯定是很早就有奶油蛋撻，然後在世界各地廣爲流傳。

sentences.english: Tarts were available throughout the day in the deli.
sentences.chinese: 在熟食店，蛋撻全天有售。

definition: rice noodle roll, a roll made from sheets of rice flour dough, steamed and stuffed with meat, vegetables etc
shumai (shao mai) steamed dumpling/also written 燒麥|烧麦[shao1 mai4]
pineapple cake, traditional Taiwanese sweet pastry
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
